body: Contrary to LFT's thread, the newest senior is technically me. ;) Anyways, I'm a little late, but may as well do one anyways, right? Ask me anything!

replies.body: A few years back. we were actually good friends and I remember playing a lot with you, and so much to the point where you even taught me some good rushing tips. I went from getting about 1-2 monuments a day to 14-21 whenever I played with you, and it was some of the most fun I had back then. I believe the last time we really had some kind of friendship was before you were promoted to junior, and I called you an elf since you'd always be sending in/calling me on to deal with rulebreakers. Nowadays, I sort of get the feeling you don't like talking to me anymore which kind of bums me out, but I'm alright with it I guess. You've gotten a bit more toxic throughout the months, but it's kind of died down now I think. I also really like how you're able to complete maps that would take me months to build in 1 day, haha.

replies.body:
How does it feel to be the last one in the trend of AMAs? ;P
Seems to have been very short lived, already like 3 new AMAs released after mine. :( Felt good while it lasted!!

What are you most excited about in regards to joining the Senior staff team?
The thing I care most about as a senior is probably the staff team overall; I really look forward to being able to give in depth comments on applications like I did a few years back as a newer moderator.

Who's your favourite Admin and why is it me? Ok no, I'll just ask for your opinion on me instead.
Well first things first, Pie was right about you being lovable; I don't think anyone on the network has a reason to personally dislike you, lol. I'm really happy that I'll be working with you to improve the staff team, and I think you'll do amazing as an admin!

Looking forwards to working with you!
As to you!

ps - I left a secret note somewhere the other day, if you find it you'll get a cookie
Better start searching!

replies.body:
Opinions?
I've always seen you as a good moderator in the past, and I even advocated for you to be promoted to junior a while back.

After being a Moderator longer than anyone else, if you were to compare the current staff team with the staff team we had when you were a Junior, what positive and negative differences are there?
Well, I believe the staff team is a lot more organized now than it was back then. The server was bigger back then, and there wasn't much of a hacker issue so whenever there weren't staff on it wasn't too big of a deal. Believe it or not, I actually don't remember much else from my time as a junior. :/

Well, I believe the staff team is a lot more organized now than it was back then. The server was bigger back then, and there wasn't much of a hacker issue so whenever there weren't staff on it wasn't too big of a deal. Believe it or not, I actually don't remember much else from my time as a junior. :/

replies.body:
Turtles are reptiles of the order Testudines (or Chelonii[3]) characterised by a special bony or cartilaginous shell developed from their ribs and acting as a shield.[4] "Turtle" may refer to the order as a whole (American English) or to fresh-water and sea-dwelling testudines (British English).[5]

Turtles
Temporal range:
Late Jurassic  Present,[1] 1570 Ma
Pre
O
S
D
C
P
T
J
K
Pg
N
Green sea turtle (Chelonia mydas)
Scientific classification
Kingdom:Animalia
Phylum:Chordata
Class:Reptilia
Clade:Testudinata
Order:Testudines
Batsch, 1788 [2]
Subgroups[1]

Cryptodira
Pleurodira
Meiolaniidae
and see text

Diversity
14 extant families with ca. 300 species
blue: sea turtles, black: land turtles

The order Testudines includes both extant (living) and extinct species. The earliest known members of this group date from 157 million years ago,[1]making turtles one of the oldest reptile groups and a more ancient group than snakes or crocodilians. Of the 327 known species alive today, some are highly endangered.[6][7]

replies.body: At the time, staff applications were some of the biggest hype fests around. I wanted to join in, because I thought it'd be fun and the idea of moderating a server I had played on for so long and grown to love came as an amazing idea. It took me three applications and two interviews to pass, and I''m still here to this day, mainly because I want to stick with the network for as long as I can.
replies.body_tagged: At the time, staff applications were some of the biggest hype fests around. I wanted to join in, because I thought it'd be fun and the idea of moderating a server I had played on for so long and grown to love came as an amazing idea. It took me three applications and two interviews to pass, and I''m still here to this day, mainly because I want to stick with the network for as long as I can.

reply_to.body: Why did you decide to become a Mod?
reply_to.body_tagged: Why did you decide to become a Mod?

replies.body:
Did you ever think of working/trying for Senior Mod before your promotion?
Yes, I did. I worked harder about a year and a half ago than I did now, and Rese and I both sort of gave each feedback and hoped each other would become senior. I sort of stopped trying after a while, since it seemed like seniors would always be promoted as soon as I went on leave or didn't have the time to do as much work lol.
How did you feel when you got promoted?
Pretty happy, but considering it was near midnight for me I was a little tired.

What can you contribute as a Senior Mod to a server like Avicus?
I'll mainly be focusing on improving our current staff team.
replies.body_tagged:

I sort of stopped trying after a while, since it seemed like seniors would always be promoted as soon as I went on leave or didn't have the time to do as much work lol.
How did you feel when you got promoted?
Pretty happy, but considering it was near midnight for me I was a little tired.

I'll mainly be focusing on improving our current staff team.

replies.body: I hardly really know you to be honest, and most of what I remember is from when you were sheamus4414, and you were mostly just a dude I saw around a lot who'd throw out some immature comments here and there. I didn't see anythig spectacular from you as a senior or mod except for your positive attitude, which most staff should have anyways. The whole "memes" gimmick is really annoying and cringeworthy in my opinion, but that's just me, I guess. As an Admin, I think since most of the community likes you you have the potential to help the server if you work hard.

The whole "memes" gimmick is really annoying and cringeworthy in my opinion, but that's just me, I guess. replies.body: A few months back where you did the whole "staying up super late to moderate" (hey, that rhymes!) thing, I found it a little scary that you were sacrificing so many hours of sleep for Minecraft. I've also noticed you've changed a lot whole from when you were mod a few months back, and I personally strongly dislike that. It began to look like you were trying to change a mass of things that made you you just to get a promotion. I personally like the old shadowolf a bit more than now, although you have your moments where your former self shines through the clouds. I also find the "meme" gimmick of you and Cammy a little cringeworthy, but I think that's just me. Other than that, you're a moderator that stands out to me and I would definitely support you "loosening-up" a little. Sorry if this was a bit blunt. :>

Other than that, you're a moderator that stands out to me and I would definitely support you "loosening-up" a little. Sorry if this was a bit blunt. :>

do you like newdawn when you first joined?
Of course! I didn't want to leave, but I had to since school was holding me back.

do you really like to be part of the staff?
Considering I've spent over two years on it, yes!

how did you feel about being a sr mod?
I was pretty excoted, and also a little tired since it was almost midnight when I was promoted. I had to be trained the next day since I wanted to go to bed, lol.

- Opinions on me 
Great friend with some of the funniest banter I've seen in a while. :>

- What is your favorite thing on the server (map etc.)
DTM overall.

- How does it feel to have slightly more power than mods?
Good...good.

"I've been a mod for over a year, so thanks! :D"

replies.body:
Opinions?
Very nice personality, and I'd love to have you as my preschool teacher if I was still a 4 year old. xd

Favorite map?
Ternio

Favorite gamemode on Avicus?
DTM

Favorite memory on Avicus?
Joining and instantly getting hooked.

What made you want to be staff?
Being able to help the first network I truly enjoyed seemed like a great idea to me, and it seemed like a good way to pay back the network. :)

replies.body:
Opinion?
I liked you better around the time when you and Porky played and you were a moderator. You're a little annoying now, and it looks kind of sad when you randomly start talking about your workouts/girls in the Discord, sorry lol. I don't think we were ever friends, but I liked talking to you back then and I tend to enjoy your debates in politics, since they're usually a lot better than the others' I argue against.

How ya feeling with the extra power?
The same, really, except I feel like I get things done faster now that i have access to IP checks and stuff.

Cookies or Chips?
Depends on the mood, love both.

replies.body:
Opinions? (It's Sem)
One of the best friends I've had on the server, and I was so happy/surprised when I won the gift card, even though it was just 10 bucks. I hope some day you send me the name of your business's Instagram, I'm pretty curious. xd

Do you think you/your team can restore Avicus to its "former glory"?
Me? Not alone.The Staff team? They can, but I think most of the weight lies on Admins/Developers.

What do you think has to be done/changed to restore Avicus to its "former glory"?
Advertising that doesn't consist of "we found a youtuber with a WHOLE 1,000 subscribers!" and absolutely nothing after. Encourage voting rewards, advertise tournaments on things like PlanetMC, not Instagram. 

Tell us something you've never told anyone.
I didn't start flossing till I was like, 11, which was probably why I ended up getting 3 cavities at the age of 10/11, even when I brushed my teeth daily.

What song is stuck in your head at the moment?
A Horse With No Name by America

replies.body:
Player: Avicus wise, I think we're on par with each other. Competitive wise, your better at pot and UHC (which I am REALLY bad at), but I think I'm a little better at soup. ;)

Person: You have rare moments where you're actually a pretty good person to talk to, not to be rude. You're usually pretty rude and/or immature.
